course_title: Studies in Music History and Culture: Jazz and Society in the 1950s
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 7Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: (This is a research course in jazz history, focusing on the seminal decade of the 1950s. It involves examination and discussion of a selection of music by the leading jazz musicians of that period, as well as investigation of the relationship between jazz and a host of broader themes, such as civil rights, international politics and diplomacy, the emergence of rock & roll, so-called third-stream music, and women in jazz. We will make extensive use of Emory's subscription to RIPM Jazz Periodicals, a digitized archive of more than 100 jazz journals and magazines published from 1914 to 2010. Each student will write a series of short essays as well as a more extensive research paper.)
course_description: This is a variable topics course in music history and culture. Each study treats a special topic in the field by implementing various research methodologies, discussion sessions, and writing of papers.
prerequisites: MUS 200 or MUS_OX 200 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 1029, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 11:20a-12:35p, Instructor: S. Crist, Status: Open
